question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Scraping DoS] If ERROR_COUNT has high cardinality, can Prometheus scraping operations become so expensive they cause timeouts, making the cache worker appear down to monitoring? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 12] [Metric Naming] Does the metric name 'indexer_grpc_cache_worker_errors' follow Prometheus naming conventions and avoid conflicts with other Aptos components that might use similar names? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 22] [Metric Naming] Is 'indexer_grpc_cache_worker_wait_for_file_store_counter' unique enough to avoid collisions with file-store-worker or other indexer components in shared Prometheus instances? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Registry Conflicts] If multiple cache worker instances run in the same process (e.g., testing), does re-registering ERROR_COUNT cause a panic or silent failure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 20-26] [Global State] Are Lazy statics safe to use in integration tests where multiple cache workers might be created and destroyed, or can registration conflicts occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 16, 25] [Unwrap Propagation] Do the unwrap() calls prevent the cache worker from implementing graceful degradation where metrics collection failures don't crash the entire service? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Metric Collection Failure] If the Prometheus client encounters errors during metric collection (e.g., network issues), are these silently ignored or do they cascade to cache worker failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Entire File] [Fallback Behavior] If metrics initialization fails, is there a fallback to log-based error tracking, or does the cache worker become completely unobservable? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 14] [Label Enumeration] Are the valid error_type values ('failed_to_update_cache_version', 'streaming_error', 'data_init_twice', 'data_end_wrong_version', 'response_error') hardcoded as constants to prevent typos and label explosion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Label Length] Are error_type label values length-limited to prevent excessively long labels that could cause buffer overflows or memory issues in the Prometheus client? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 14] [Special Characters] Can error_type labels contain special characters (newlines, quotes, Prometheus syntax) that could break metric parsing or scraping? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Incorrect Label Usage] If worker.rs code calls ERROR_COUNT.with_label_values() with wrong number of labels or incorrect label order, does this cause a panic at runtime or silent metric loss? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 20-26] [Direct vs Labeled Access] Can WAIT_FOR_FILE_STORE_COUNTER be accidentally used with .with_label_values() even though it's not a CounterVec, causing runtime errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Missing Increments] Are there code paths in worker.rs where errors occur but ERROR_COUNT is not incremented, causing under-reporting of actual failure rates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 20-26] [Redundant Increments] Can WAIT_FOR_FILE_STORE_COUNTER be incremented multiple times for the same wait event, causing over-counting and misleading metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Information Disclosure] Do ERROR_COUNT metrics expose sensitive information about cache worker internal state, transaction processing details, or fullnode endpoints that could aid attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 20-26] [Timing Attack] Can observing WAIT_FOR_FILE_STORE_COUNTER patterns allow attackers to infer file store performance characteristics, batch processing timings, or predict when the cache is vulnerable? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Entire File] [Metric Manipulation] If an attacker gains access to the Prometheus push gateway or metrics endpoint, can they manipulate or reset counters to hide evidence of attacks or create false alerts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Error Flooding] Can an attacker deliberately trigger specific error types to flood ERROR_COUNT, making legitimate errors harder to detect in monitoring dashboards? (Low)

(Medium)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Cache Update Failures] When 'failed_to_update_cache_version' is incremented at worker.rs:268-270, does this indicate Redis connection failure, data corruption, or transaction validation failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 20-26] [File Store Lag Detection] When WAIT_FOR_FILE_STORE_COUNTER increments at worker.rs:494, does this create an alert if the file store is consistently lagging by FILE_STORE_VERSIONS_RESERVED (150,000 txns)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10-17] [Response Processing Errors] When 'response_error' is counted at worker.rs:428,473, does this distinguish between transaction processing failures vs. task execution failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-cache-worker/src/metrics.rs] [Lines: 10, 20] [Type Safety] Are IntCounterVec and IntCounter types the correct choice for monotonically increasing error counts, or should Gauge be used for certain metrics that can decrease? (Low)
